summary: The term "parliament" within the EU legal and regulatory framework refers to the legislative body responsible for representing the interests of EU citizens. It plays a crucial role in the legislative process, including the formulation, amendment, and adoption of EU laws. The European Parliament, as a key institution, engages in dialogue with the Council of the European Union to ensure democratic legitimacy and accountability. It also exercises oversight over other EU institutions, contributing to the regulatory landscape by scrutinizing proposals and ensuring compliance with EU treaties. This institution embodies the principles of representation and participatory democracy in the EU governance structure.
